sub_topic: Calculating the circumference of a circle.
message_1: If the radius of a circle is 6 cm, what is the circumference of the circle?
message_2:
The circumference of a circle is given by the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius. In this case, the radius is 6 cm.

C = 2π(6 cm) = 12π cm ≈ 37.68 cm

The circumference of the circle is approximately 37.68 cm.
